oai_dc:dc.dc:title: CERTCOST – Ökonomische Analyse von Bio-Kontrollsystemen auf EU Ebene
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Dabbert, Stephan
Lippert, Christian
Schulz, Tatjana
Zorn, Alexander
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Regulation
Markets and trade
Values, standards and certification
Produce chain management
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The EU funded project CERTCOST proposes to combine the experience and knowledge of both researchers and SMEs to analyse the implementation of organic certification systems and to estimate all relevant expenditures or transaction costs for different certification systems along the organic food supply chain. Benefits of certification will also be analysed, using data on consumers’ recognition and willingness to pay for different organic logos and trademarks. Finally, recommendations will be drawn for the EU Commission, national competent authorities and private actors in organic food and farming on how to increase effectiveness and efficiency of organic certification.
